definition:
A permutation group acting on a countably infinite set is called
*oligomorphic*, if it has finitely many orbits of $n$-tuples, for all
$n \geq 1$.

Ryll-Nardzewski, Engeler, and Svenonius proved that a countably infinite
first-order structure has an oligomorphic automorphism group if and only
if the structure is $\omega$-categorical.
